Is it true that if $A\subseteq \mathbb{Z}/N\mathbb{Z}$ has size $\gg N^{1/2}$ then there exists some non-empty $S\subseteq A$ such that $\sum_{n\in S}n\equiv 0\pmod{N}$?



A conjecture of Erd\H{o}s and Heilbronn \cite{ErHe64}. The answer is yes. This was proved for $N$ prime by Olson \cite{Ol68}, and for all $N$ by Szemer\'{e}di \cite{Sz70} (in fact for arbitrary finite abelian groups).

Erd\H{o}s speculated that perhaps the correct threshold is $(2N)^{1/2}$; this is also a conjecture of Selfridge, and has been proved when $N$ is prime by Balandraud \cite{Ba12}.

Hamidoune and Z\'{e}mor \cite{HaZe96} proved the bound $(1+o(1))\sqrt{2N}$ for arbitrary abelian groups of order $N$.

This is discussed in problem C15 of Guy's collection \cite{Gu04}.




References


[Ba12] Balandraud, \'{e}ric, An addition theorem and maximal zero-sum free sets in {${\Bbb
Z}/p{\Bbb Z}$}. Israel J. Math. (2012), 405-429.

[ErHe64] Erd\H{o}s, P. and Heilbronn, H., On the addition of residue classes {${\rm mod}\ p$}. Acta Arith. (1964), 149--159.

[Gu04] Guy, Richard K., Unsolved problems in number theory. (2004), xviii+437.

[HaZe96] Hamidoune, Yahya Ould and Z\'{e}mor, Gilles, On zero-free subset sums. Acta Arith. (1996), 143--152.

[Ol68] Olson, John E., An addition theorem modulo {$p$}. J. Combinatorial Theory (1968), 45--52.

[Sz70] Szemer\'{e}di, E., On a conjecture of Erd\H{o}s and Heilbronn. Acta Arith. (1970), 227-229.
